extendedIngredients.name: low sodium chicken stock
extendedIngredients.original: 1 cup chicken stock or low-sodium broth

extendedIngredients.name: red bell pepper
extendedIngredients.original: 1 small red bell pepper, cut into 1-inch-long strips
extendedIngredients.originalName: red bell pepper, cut into 1-inch-long strips

title: Chili Lobster
summary: Chili Lobster is a gluten free, dairy free, and pescatarian main course. This recipe serves 10 and costs $1.77 per serving. One portion of this dish contains approximately 17g of protein, 7g of fat, and a total of 157 calories. It will be a hit at your The Super Bowl event. It is an affordable recipe for fans of American food. This recipe from Food and Wine has 1 fans. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 1 hour. A mixture of baby bok choy, chicken stock, garlic cloves, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so flavorful. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 44%. This score is good. Try Dry-Rubbed Rib-Eye with Chili Lobster, Dr. BBQ's Lobster with Chili-Lime Butter, and Grilled Lobster with Creamy Chili Vinaigrette for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Lobster on the menu? Try pairing with Chablis and Chardonnay. Chablis is perfect with lobster, but a chardonny from other regions is bound to hit the spot too. One wine you could try is Domaine Louis Moreau Chablis Vaulignot Premier Cru. It has 4.6 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 40 dollars.

productMatches.title: Domaine Louis Moreau Chablis Vaulignot Premier Cru
productMatches.description: Chablis achieves its highly distinctive mineral character due to its cool northerly climate and its highly calcareous soil. The Domaine Louis Moreau Chablis Vaulignot Premier Cru has a classic Chablis character, with an elegant minerality and a rich, full palate. Hints of mint and pineapple on the nose, and a long finish.

instructions: In a large pot of boiling water, cook the baby bok choy until it's bright green, about 1 minute. Using a slotted spoon, transfer the bok choy to a large rimmed baking sheet and pat dry with paper towels. Cover the baking sheet with foil.                                              Bring the pot of water back to a boil. Add the lobsters and cook until they're bright red all over, about 7 minutes. Transfer the lobsters to another large rimmed baking sheet and let cool slightly. Twist the tails off of the lobster bodies; crack the claws and knuckles and remove the meat. Using scissors, cut along the underside of the tail shells and remove the meat. Remove and discard the dark intestinal veins; cut the tails into 2-inch pieces. Arrange the lobster meat on the baking sheet, cover with a moistened kitchen towel and then cover tightly with foil.                                              Preheat the oven to 375. In a medium skillet, heat the vegetable oil. Add the chopped garlic and cook over moderately low heat until golden brown, about 4 minutes. Add the chicken stock, ketchup and sambal oelek and simmer over moderately high heat for 2 minutes. Add the egg and cook, stirring frequently, until fully incorporated and the sauce is thickened, about 30 seconds. Remove the sauce from the heat and season with salt, then transfer to a serving bowl.                                              Bake the covered lobster and baby bok choy for about 7 minutes, or until heated through. Mound the lobster meat on a platter, arrange the bok choy alongside it and garnish with the red pepper strips. Serve at once with the chili sauce.

steps.step: In a large pot of boiling water, cook the baby bok choy until it's bright green, about 1 minute. Using a slotted spoon, transfer the bok choy to a large rimmed baking sheet and pat dry with paper towels. Cover the baking sheet with foil.
Bring the pot of water back to a boil.
Add the lobsters and cook until they're bright red all over, about 7 minutes.

Transfer the lobsters to another large rimmed baking sheet and let cool slightly. Twist the tails off of the lobster bodies; crack the claws and knuckles and remove the meat. Using scissors, cut along the underside of the tail shells and remove the meat.
Remove and discard the dark intestinal veins; cut the tails into 2-inch pieces. Arrange the lobster meat on the baking sheet, cover with a moistened kitchen towel and then cover tightly with foil.
In a medium skillet, heat the vegetable oil.
Add the chopped garlic and cook over moderately low heat until golden brown, about 4 minutes.
Add the chicken stock, ketchup and sambal oelek and simmer over moderately high heat for 2 minutes.
Add the egg and cook, stirring frequently, until fully incorporated and the sauce is thickened, about 30 seconds.
Remove the sauce from the heat and season with salt, then transfer to a serving bowl.
Bake the covered lobster and baby bok choy for about 7 minutes, or until heated through. Mound the lobster meat on a platter, arrange the bok choy alongside it and garnish with the red pepper strips.
Serve at once with the chili sauce.
